prompt_to_run:
You will be given a task consisting of two parts:
1. A word-learning phase where you will be shown examples of a new word and give a similarity score of the word.
2. A similarity judgement phase where you will be asked to rate the similarity of pairs of objects for a total of 50 objects.


Mr. Frog speaks a different language, and you are helping him to pick out the object he wants. You'll be given a novel word and some examples of the word.

Here are three shars:
1. green bell pepper
2. potato
3. eggplant

Now pick out the other shars from the following list:
1. pumpkin
2. bee
3. green bell pepper
4. crane
5. basset hound
6. full-trailer truck
7. Labrador
8. eggplant
9. yellow bell pepper
10. bear
11. loader
12. car
13. box truck
14. school bus
15. carrot
16. red bell pepper
17. onion
18. cat
19. chiller truck
20. Dalmatian
21. seal


Next, for each pair of the objects below, rate the similarity of the two objects on a scale of 1 (not similar at all) to 9 (extremely similar). Try your best to base your ratings on the same aspects of the objects that were important to you in making your choices during the word-learning phase:

1. Labrador and toucan
2. mutt and crane
3. loader and toucan
4. eggplant and mutt
5. pig and crane
6. onion and red bell pepper
7. motorcycle and red bell pepper
8. bear and box truck
9. semi-trailer truck and red bell pepper
10. full-trailer truck and yellow bell pepper
11. red bell pepper and carrot
12. onion and Dalmatian
13. potato and green bell pepper
14. full-trailer truck and basset hound
15. motorcycle and box truck
16. eggplant and school bus
17. cat and yellow bell pepper
18. semi-trailer truck and car
19. school bus and potato
20. mutt and box truck
21. full-trailer truck and pig
22. motorcycle and full-trailer truck
23. pumpkin and box truck
24. semi-trailer truck and chiller truck
25. pumpkin and chiller truck
26. motorcycle and tractor
27. semi-trailer truck and pig
28. Dalmatian and car
29. motorcycle and mutt
30. Dalmatian and loader
31. eggplant and bee
32. carrot and toucan
33. onion and toucan
34. pig and box truck
35. full-trailer truck and red bell pepper
36. tractor and box truck
37. tractor and Dalmatian
38. seal and semi-trailer truck
39. bear and green bell pepper
40. motorcycle and school bus
41. tractor and cat
42. potato and box truck
43. pumpkin and tractor
44. garbage truck and red bell pepper
45. bee and green bell pepper
46. cat and terrier
47. pumpkin and carrot
48. cat and potato
49. yellow bell pepper and terrier
50. pumpkin and cat


The output should be formatted as a JSON instance that conforms to the JSON schema below.

As an example, for the schema {"properties": {"foo": {"title": "Foo", "description": "a list of strings", "type": "array", "items": {"type": "string"}}}, "required": ["foo"]}
the object {"foo": ["bar", "baz"]} is a well-formatted instance of the schema. The object {"properties": {"foo": ["bar", "baz"]}} is not well-formatted.

Here is the output schema:
```
{"properties": {"objects_chosen": {"description": "objects that the word applied to", "items": {"type": "string"}, "title": "Objects Chosen", "type": "array"}, "choice_explanation": {"description": "explanation of objects chosen", "title": "Choice Explanation", "type": "string"}, "similarity_score": {"additionalProperties": {"type": "integer"}, "description": "similarity score for each pair of objects", "title": "Similarity Score", "type": "object"}}, "required": ["objects_chosen", "choice_explanation", "similarity_score"]}
```

Please be sure to give similarity scores to ALL 50 pairs of objects listed above.
